areaSection: Orihuela Costa represents the southern jewel of the Costa Blanca, stretching along the Alicante coastline with a distinctly more laid-back, residential character than its northern counterpart. This thriving coastal community sits approximately 50 kilometers south of Alicante city, positioned perfectly between the upscale Campoamor area and the vibrant Playa Flamenca beachfront. The region enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine and a mild Mediterranean climate year-round, making it ideal for those seeking permanent warmth. Villamartín, where this penthouse is located, has evolved into one of the Costa Blanca's most sought-after residential zones, famous for its championship golf courses and family-friendly atmosphere. The area's infrastructure has developed substantially, with modern amenities, quality healthcare facilities, and excellent shopping centers complementing the natural beauty of nearby beaches and coastal pathways.
lifestyleSection: Life in Orihuela Costa embodies Mediterranean relaxation with cosmopolitan convenience. The expat community here is remarkably inclusive—British, Scandinavian, and Dutch residents have established a welcoming culture where English is universally spoken, making integration effortless. Your daily routine might include morning beach walks at La Zenia or Campoamor, leisurely lunches at beachfront chiringuitos, and afternoons on championship golf courses practically on your doorstep. The local markets pulse with fresh Mediterranean produce, while La Zenia Boulevard and nearby shopping centers provide everything from international brands to specialty goods. Weekend entertainment ranges from waterfront dining to cultural events, with a thriving restaurant scene catering to diverse tastes. Healthcare standards are high, with English-speaking doctors and modern medical facilities nearby. The region maintains a peaceful, unhurried pace while offering the sophistication and services you'd expect from a premium coastal destination.
investmentSection: Beyond the lifestyle benefits, this penthouse represents a smart financial decision. Orihuela Costa properties have appreciated 10% year-on-year, positioning this €425,000 purchase at the forefront of market growth. Holiday rental data shows 7-night bookings averaging €800 in the region—meaning your penthouse could generate €41,600 annually if rented just 13 weeks per year. The premium specification justifies the €4,126/m² price point, which remains 35% below comparable Costa Blanca North properties, offering significant appreciation potential. Strong international demand for holiday rentals, combined with the area's growing reputation and infrastructure improvements, supports consistent value growth. Whether you're seeking capital appreciation, rental income, or personal enjoyment, this property delivers measurable returns alongside the intangible value of Mediterranean living.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Orihuela Costa meets international standards with English-speaking medical professionals throughout the region. Hospital de Torrevieja, just 15 minutes away, is a modern private facility offering emergency services, specialist care, and surgical facilities. Quirónsalud hospital provides additional private healthcare options 20 minutes away. Local medical centers with English staff are conveniently located throughout Villamartín and surrounding areas, making routine care and consultations straightforward. Spanish healthcare quality ranks among Europe's best, with prescription costs substantially lower than UK or Northern European standards. Medical tourism is common in this region, with facilities equipped for international patients.

education.text: International education options serve families throughout Orihuela Costa, with several established schools offering British and international curricula. El Limonar International School operates just 15 minutes away, providing education for ages 3-18 with a strong international community. Kings College Murcia, 40 minutes distant, offers further educational options. Many families integrate children into Spanish public schools, which are well-regarded and completely free. The expat community has created strong support networks for families considering education options. Bilingual development is a natural benefit of living on the Costa Blanca.

shopping.text: Shopping in Orihuela Costa ranges from daily essentials to luxury goods, with supermarkets and retail centers throughout the area. La Zenia Boulevard, 12 minutes away, houses 140+ stores including major Spanish and international retailers. Local Mercadona, Consum, and Lidl supermarkets provide everyday groceries and household items at excellent Spanish prices—typically 30-40% less than UK equivalents. Weekly markets operate throughout the region, offering fresh produce, local specialties, and authentic Spanish shopping experiences. Pharmacy chains are ubiquitous with professional, English-speaking staff. The combination of modern shopping centers and traditional markets creates a comprehensive retail environment.

transport.text: Transportation around Orihuela Costa is most convenient by car, with excellent roads connecting all local attractions. Alicante-Elche Airport, Spain's third-busiest, sits 45 minutes away with direct flights to most major European cities and beyond. Local bus services operate between towns, though frequency is limited—a rental car provides maximum freedom for exploring. Driving throughout the region is straightforward with well-maintained coastal and inland roads. Public parking is available at beaches and shopping centers. Car hire is exceptionally affordable, with weekly rates starting around €150 for compact vehicles. The flat coastal terrain makes cycling increasingly popular for local journeys.

faqs.question: Is Orihuela Costa a good place to live?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Orihuela Costa offers an ideal blend of Mediterranean lifestyle, modern amenities, and established infrastructure. The region boasts over 300 days of annual sunshine, pristine beaches, championship golf courses, and a welcoming international expat community where English is widely spoken. Healthcare and education facilities meet international standards, while costs of living—particularly groceries and dining—are significantly lower than Northern Europe. It's especially suited for holiday home seekers and retirees.

faqs.question: What is Orihuela Costa known for?
faqs.answer: Orihuela Costa is renowned for its championship golf courses (particularly Villamartín), Blue Flag beaches, and year-round Mediterranean climate. The region attracts holiday home buyers and retirees seeking sunshine, affordability, and quality of life. It's also known for its strong international community, excellent seafood restaurants, and being more relaxed and residential compared to busier Costa Blanca North areas.

faqs.question: Is Orihuela Costa safe?
faqs.answer: Yes, Orihuela Costa is considered safe with low crime rates typical of established coastal communities. The area benefits from a well-integrated, responsible expat population and active community policing. Residential developments like Villamartín maintain security standards, and local authorities maintain good public safety. Standard travel precautions apply as with any European destination.

faqs.question: How far is Orihuela Costa from Alicante?
faqs.answer: Orihuela Costa is approximately 50 kilometers south of Alicante city center, typically a 45-50 minute drive depending on traffic. Alicante-Elche Airport, Spain's third-busiest international airport, is approximately 45 minutes away and offers direct flights to most major European cities. This proximity provides convenient access to flights while maintaining the peaceful, residential character of the Orihuela Costa area.

faqs.question: Can I rent out this penthouse for holiday income?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Holiday rental properties in Orihuela Costa generate average weekly bookings of €800, translating to €41,600 annually with just 13 weeks of bookings. The established tourism infrastructure, proximity to beaches and golf courses, and strong European demand make this penthouse well-suited for rental income. Professional property management companies throughout Orihuela Costa handle bookings, maintenance, and guest services.

faqs.question: What beaches are near this property?
faqs.answer: Three exceptional beaches are within 18 minutes drive. La Zenia Beach (Blue Flag certified) is just 8 minutes away, offering pristine sands and quality facilities. Campoamor Beach, 10 minutes away, provides a more intimate family-friendly cove with beachfront restaurants. Playa Flamenca and Cabo Roig beaches are equally accessible, each offering distinct characters from family-friendly to upscale waterfront dining.

faqs.question: Are there golf courses near the property?
faqs.answer: Villamartín Golf Club is practically on the doorstep, with multiple championship 18-hole courses available. Las Ramblas, Campoamor, Las Colinas, and Vistabella golf courses are all within 15-25 minutes. The region is a golfer's paradise with year-round playing conditions, professional facilities, and reasonable green fees compared to Northern European standards.

faqs.question: Is English widely spoken in Orihuela Costa?
faqs.answer: Yes, very widely. The established British, Scandinavian, and Dutch expat communities mean English is universally understood in shops, restaurants, healthcare facilities, and services throughout Villamartín and Orihuela Costa. You'll find English-speaking doctors, lawyers, financial advisors, and property managers—making the transition to coastal living straightforward for international residents.
